articles.title: Larry Ellison wants to put all America's data, including DNA, in one big Oracle system for AI to study
articles.author: Brandon Vigliarolo
articles.summary: The world's fourth-most-richest man, Larry Ellison, believes that artificial intelligence is going to change everyone's lives "across the board". He believes governments need to put all their data about their citizens in one place to be analyzed by AI. He believes the payoff will include better healthcare, treatments tailored to individuals and better food production.

articles.title: Autry Technology Center to Host AI Summit
articles.author: That Sneaker Wearing
articles.summary: Autry Technology Center is preparing to host its first-ever artificial intelligence summit on March 7, 2025. Keynote speaker is Sean Alexander, a 25-year veteran of Microsoft and a leader in the field of artificial intelligence. Sessions include "AI 101: Unlocking the Basics with ChatGPT," "AI in Education," "Building Smarter Chatbots with AI," and "Mastering Creativity with Photoshop AI." Registration for the event is $125.

articles.title: Turns out the reason Total War: Warhammer 3's campaign AI sometimes played too defensively was a bug that made it overreact to the presence of even a single hero
articles.author: Jody Macgregor
articles.summary: Creative Assembly has announced improvements to the campaign AI in Total War: Warhammer 3's beta. The changes are all about making the AI more active. The beta starts on February 13th and runs for two weeks. The developers warn that using mods in conjunction with the beta "will lead to unexpected results".

articles.title: For dispatch centers, AI can be useful, but never replace ‘the human factor'
articles.author: Sartaj Singh
articles.summary: Smart Response Technologies' new program Delphine aims to provide a security blanket for dispatchers transcribing 911 calls with the use of artificial intelligence. The technology was recently shown off at a demo at The Hub in downtown Dayton. Capt. Jay Wheeler with the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office says AI can be useful, but it's not a replacement for humans.

articles.title: Reddit, Pinterest, Snap: The hidden AI players worth watching
articles.author: Josh Lipton
articles.summary: Venture Partner Kamran Ansari discusses investment opportunities beyond Big Tech in the artificial intelligence sector with Asking for a Trend. Ansari notes that among Big Tech names, "it's an arms race" to get ahead in artificial intelligence. He distinguishes between companies like Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Amazon (AMZN), and Microsoft (MSFT), and smaller social media platforms Pinterest (PINS), Reddit (RDDT), and Snap Inc. (SNAP).

articles.title: Google Gemini adds its personal AI researcher to your iPhone – if you have the right subscription
articles.author: Eric Hal Schwartz
articles.summary: Deep Research is an AI-powered tool for compiling information. It's the first 'agentic' feature in Google's Gemini AI assistant. It debuted on Gemini's web portal in December and rolled out to Android earlier this month. The launch of Deep Research on iPhones signals how aggressively Google is leaning into Gemini for all kinds of productivity demands.

articles.title: FBI issues warning on romance scams ahead of Valentine's Day
articles.summary: The FBI is issuing a warning about the rise of online romance scams. According to the FTC, romance schemes cost victims more than $1 billion in 2023. Artificial intelligence is helping cybercriminals act with authenticity by masquerading as real people with realistic voices they use to talk to victims on the phone.

articles.title: Too many models, too much confusion: OpenAI pledges to simplify its product line
articles.summary: OpenAI is preparing to release its last non-reasoning AI model, GPT-4.5. CEO Sam Altman wants to simplify its product offerings. Altman is unhappy with ChatGPT's model picker, where users tap a drop-down to choose from released models. The number of models a user can choose depends on their subscription tier.

articles.title: Google to test using AI to determine users' ages
articles.author: Jennifer Elias
articles.summary: Google will start using artificial intelligence to determine whether users are age appropriate for its products. The automation will be used across Google products, including YouTube. Google has billions of users across its properties and users designated as under the age of 18 have restrictions to some Google services.

articles.title: Speaker - Becky Wagner
articles.summary: No-Code AI for Business Processes session is led by Becky Wagner, Founder, CEO, and AI Architect at Iris Blue Technology. The session will teach you how to integrate AI into your business operations without a team of data scientists or a massive IT budget.

articles.title: New Research Suggests Overreliance on AI Could Hinders Critical Thinking
articles.author: Imad Khan
articles.summary: Researchers at Microsoft and Carnegie Mellon University found that overreliance on AI systems may hinder our critical thinking potential. The study will be presented at the CHI conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems in Yokohama, Japan, in April. Big Tech CEOs have been offloading more tasks to AI, leading to layoffs and fewer job opportunities.

articles.title: Steve Rao: Wake County can lead the AI revolution
articles.author: Steve Rao
articles.summary: Wake County has all the ingredients to harness the power of AI to improve government services, drive economic growth, and enhance the quality of life for its residents. North Carolina State University's College of Education is leading the way in integrating AI into education. Wake Tech Community College is promoting AI education and awareness. Wake County is piloting an AI School Safety Program, using advanced technology to detect security threats in schools.

articles.title: Wesleyan College to offer AI-focused MBA concentration this fall
articles.author: Bre'Anna Sheffield
articles.summary: Wesleyan College in Macon, Georgia will offer MBA contractions in artificial intelligence (AI), finance, healthcare, cybersecurity, business analytics and nonprofit management starting in the fall of 2025. Seth David Selke, professor of business, believes teaching AI is critical for this generation.

articles.title: AI Chip Market Research Report 2029: $117.50 Bn Worth Market
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: According to Arizton's latest research report, the global AI chip market is growing at a CAGR of 31.05% during 2023-2029. The market size (2029) is $117.50 billion, according to the report.

articles.title: 'DeepSeek moved me to tears': How young Chinese find therapy in AI
articles.author: Kelly Ng
articles.summary: Holly Wang, 28, uses the AI chatbot DeepSeek for emotional support before bedtime every night. Since January, the breakout Chinese AI app has become a source of comfort for young Chinese disillusioned about their future. The chatbot has struck a chord in China partly because it is far better than other homegrown AI apps.

articles.title: Too many models, too much confusion: OpenAI pledges to simplify its product line
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman wants to simplify its AI product offerings. Altman took exception to ChatGPT's model picker and wants to unify o-series and GPT-series models. OpenAI's next step is releasing GPT 4.5, its last non-chain-of-thought model.

articles.title: EU Launches InvestAI Initiative to Build AI Gigafactories Across Europe
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: InvestAI is a €20 billion European fund dedicated to building AI gigafactories. Each gigafactory will house around 100,000 state-of-the-art AI chips. This immense processing power is essential for training complex AI models used in fields like medicine and scientific research. It will operate on a cooperative, open-source model.

articles.title: Author Post: Why the Book Business Holds the Keys to Ethical AI
articles.author: Nadim Sadek
articles.summary: The publishing industry sits at an unprecedented intersection of content creation, knowledge dissemination and intellectual property rights. Stephen Pinker's observation that every living thing is essentially a survival machine has profound implications for how we approach AI development. Publishing's influence over AI development may be one of its most valuable assets.

articles.title: Understanding AI
articles.author: Maksym Hart
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is a rapidly evolving field that has garnered significant attention and investment in recent years. In healthcare, AI is used for diagnostic purposes, personalized treatment plans and drug discovery. In finance, AI algorithms are used for fraud detection, algorithmic trading and personalized financial advice. AI-driven virtual assistants like Apple's Siri, Amazon's Alexa and Google Assistant are integral to daily life. AI raises ethical and societal concerns.

articles.title: Trump's Proposed Chip Tariffs Threaten AI—and the Entire Stock Market
articles.author: Tae Kim
articles.summary: The U.S. is poised to win the artificial intelligence race against China. American chip companies and AI models are innovating rapidly. The Trump administration is looking to relax energy and permitting regulations to alleviate energy bottlenecks. Global investors seem willing to fund a massive AI infrastructure buildout with projects like Stargate. President Donald Trump may snatch defeat from the jaws of victory with fixation on chip tariffs.

articles.title: UAB AI Tool Can Identify College Students At Risk For Anxiety and Depression
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: A new AI-powered tool, developed by Dr. Xin Zhai and his team at the University of Alabama at Birmingham, aims to identify college students who may be at risk for anxiety and depression. It analyzes existing data collected from students without requiring them to fill out additional forms. It delves into the interplay of various factors that can contribute to mental health issues. It provides counselors with data-driven insights.

articles.title: My View: How technology is broadening health care's impact in Arizona
articles.author: Bryan Saba
articles.summary: Governor Hobbs called for accessible and affordable health care in her State of the State address. Over 13% of Arizona's adults lack health care coverage and nearly 30% lack a personal doctor. Bryan Saba is the founder of reCare.ai, a patient engagement software firm. He works at the intersection of tech and health care.

articles.title: Sam Altman details the plan for OpenAI's GPT-5
articles.author: Ana Altchek
articles.summary: Free ChatGPT users will get unlimited chat access to GPT-5. OpenAI is aiming to simplify its offerings by unifying its chatbot models and removing the model picker. Altman said Orion will launch as its final non-chain-of-thought model. The new models will be available in a matter of weeks or months.

articles.title: Sam Altman details the plan for OpenAI's GPT-5
articles.summary: Free ChatGPT users will get unlimited chat access to GPT-5. Sam Altman said OpenAI is aiming to simplify its offerings by unifying its chatbot models and removing the model picker. The new chatbot Orion will be the last non-chain-of-thought model. Altman wrote that the new models will be available in a matter of weeks or months.

articles.title: Sam Altman details the plan for OpenAI's GPT-5
articles.author: Ana Altchek
articles.summary: Free ChatGPT users will get unlimited chat access to GPT-5. OpenAI is aiming to simplify its offerings by unifying its chatbot models and removing the model picker. Altman said the new models will be available in a matter of weeks or months.

articles.title: OpenAI will offer free ChatGPT users unlimited access to GPT-5
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic
articles.summary: OpenAI's upcoming GPT-5 release will integrate its o3 reasoning model and be available to free users. The company is also working to simplify how users interact with ChatGPT. Altman did not provide an exact timeline for either GPT 4.5 or GPT 5.

articles.title: Why Is ChatGPT So Slow? A Simple Maintenance Step You've Probably Ignored
articles.author: Trisha Faulkner
articles.summary: Something you aren't doing could be the reason your ChatGPT is running so slow. If you've never cleaned up your chats or managed ChatGpt's memory, you might be unknowingly causing the problem yourself. Chat GPT runs on massive servers when too many people use it at once, so response times suffer.

articles.title: Your iPhone and Mac Might Have Turned Apple Intelligence Back on Without Permission
articles.author: Jowi Morales
articles.summary: Apple's latest updates can turn the Apple Intelligence feature back on without you realizing. Users who received the macOS Sequoia 15.3.1 and iOS/iPadOS 18.3 and have previously deactivated Apple Intelligence have reported seeing the feature turned back on. If you have an iPad Air or Pro running an Apple-silicon chip, you should check your settings to see if Apple Intelligence is turned on.

articles.title: OpenAI plans to simplify AI products in new road map for latest models, CEO Altman says
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI will not release "o3" as a standalone artificial intelligence model. Instead, it will release a GPT-5 model as a comprehensive AI system that will incorporate o3 along with other technologies. The announcement comes after Chinese startup DeepSeek unveiled a low-cost AI model last month.

articles.title: OpenAI is rethinking how AI models handle controversial topics
articles.author: Kylie Robison
articles.summary: OpenAI is releasing a new version of its Model Specimen, a document that defines how its AI models should behave. It is free for anyone to use or modify. The new 63-page specification is up from 10 pages in the previous version. It lays out three main principles: customizability, transparency and intellectual freedom. It also addresses current AI ethics debates and controversies from the past year.

articles.title: Office Technology Comes to the Movies: Test Your Knowledge With Our Quiz
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: Do you know which films featured AI or hacking or the introduction of job-killing computers? If so, please share them with CNN iReport.com.  For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 90 90 90 or visit a local Samaritans branch or click here.

articles.title: Study: Relying on Artificial Intelligence Reduces Critical Thinking Skills
articles.author: Paul Bois
articles.summary: A new study shows that overreliance on artificial intelligence (AI) to perform certain tasks reduces critical thinking skills. The study was conducted by Carnegie Mellon and Microsoft. It found that people who use AI regularly for basic, routine tasks will lose their ability for complex critical thinking.

articles.title: SmartOne.ai's Tech Workforce Services: Innovation Without Borders
articles.author: Smart One.ai
articles.summary: SmartOne.ai organizes, categorizes, and labels data to deliver the highest-quality outcomes for enterprise, AI models, ML, and LLM projects. SmartOne is committed to unlocking the limitless potential of technology and human insight. Over the past decade, its experts have delivered data solutions across over forty industries.

articles.title: AI Companionship: How AI Will Help Astronauts in Space
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: AI-powered augmented reality (AR) systems hold potential for improving astronaut collaboration and task performance. Brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) offer a groundbreaking avenue for direct interaction and control. AI algorithms can be trained to monitor vital systems on the International Space Station and alert mission control to potential problems.

articles.title: OpenAI unveils roadmap for future AI models: What to expect from GPT-4.5 and GPT-5
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: OpenAI has shared its roadmap for the next generation of AI models. GPT-4.5 will be the last version of the current AI model before Gpt-5, which merges the capabilities of GPT and o-series models to create a unified system. Free version of ChatGPT will let users interact with the new AI model at a standard intelligence level. Pro subscribers will get an even more advanced version with voice, a canvas interface and integrated search.

articles.title: LITSLINK releases guide on how to build an AI assistant
articles.author: LITSLINK
articles.summary: LITSLINK has the skills and knowledge necessary for growing robust and scalable AI solutions. The company guides clients through every step of AI development, from ideation to deployment with their team of skilled professionals. LITSLink has extensive experience in delivering customized AI assistants and provides organizations with tools to automate repetitive tasks and enhance customer engagement.

articles.title: Austin AI Alliance sets out to measure progress of local efforts
articles.author: Brent Wistrom
articles.summary: Austin AI Alliance wants to track the impact of local innovations on AI innovation and produce an annual report. The alliance's membership includes large companies such as Dell Technologies and IBM, as well as tech organizations such as Austin Women in Technology, The University of Texas Machine Learning Laboratory and the city of Austin. Austin has adopted ethical AI guidelines intended to protect the privacy of its employees and residents.

articles.title: Anya Petrova on AI Art: Can Machines Express Emotion?
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Anya Petrova is a renowned AI artist and founder of the innovative studio 'Chromatic Visions.' Her groundbreaking work blends machine learning algorithms with artistic vision. Petrova believes that AI is a powerful tool for augmenting creativity and not replacing it. She believes that true creativity lies in the intersection of human inventiveness and technological innovation.

articles.title: Apple Explores Robotics as Potential Growth Area
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Apple is looking at both humanoid and non-humanoid robotic prototypes. The tech giant's main priorities are user interactions with robots rather than their outward look. An Apple-branded robot is unlikely to reach consumers until 2028 or later, according to Ming-Chi Kuo.

articles.title: OpenAI lays out plans for GPT-5
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI's product lineup has gotten complicated and the company wants to do a better job of simplifying its offerings. GPT-4.5 will be the company's last non-chain-of-thought AI model. Free ChatGPT users will get unlimited chat access at the standard intelligence setting and Pro subscribers will get an even higher level of intelligence.

articles.title: This startup uses AI to understand blueprints: Bild AI
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Y Combinator-backed startup Bild AI uses AI to read construction blueprints and extract material and cost data for builders. The startup's first clients have used BildAI to bid on 10 times more projects with confidence in the accuracy of the estimates. It also ensures there is code compliance before submitting blueprints for permitting.

articles.title: ‘AI.com' now redirects to DeepSeek website
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: The domain 'AI.com' redirects to the website of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek's chatbot. The domain was first registered in May 1993. It has since been owned by multiple tech companies, including OpenAI, HubSpot and Elon Musk's xAI.

articles.title: TechIngenious Announces AI-Driven Transformation in Mobile App Development
articles.author: Newsfile Corp.
articles.summary: TechIngenious, a leading mobile app development company based in Jaipur, India, has integrated AI-driven solutions into all its development projects. The company's clients include 3D printing, Health, 3dworks me, ecommerce, Hearing aids, fitness, Construction, marketing, and many more. The clientele includes from different industries. TechIngeniously has expanded its footprint globally, delivering top-tier solutions to markets in the United States, UK, Australia, and UAE.

articles.title: Indonesia Urges ASEAN to Design AI Education Policy
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Dr. Stella Christie is the Deputy Minister of Higher Education, Science, and Technology. She has called for ASEAN member states to establish a comprehensive education policy addressing the use of artificial intelligence (AI). She outlined three key aspects of AI literacy: understanding the human-AI interaction in problem-solving, being able to assess whether a problem is suitable for AI solutions, and developing strategies that effectively combine human and artificial intelligence to tackle complex challenges.

articles.title: Prevent Cancer Foundation awards $1 million in new research grants
articles.author: Prevent Cancer Foundation
articles.summary: The Prevent Cancer Foundation announces new funding for ten scientists. Each scientist has been awarded $100,000 for a two-year period. Areas of focus include brain, breast, cervical, head and neck, kidney, lung, ovarian, prostate, skin (including melanoma), and uterine cancers.

articles.title: Why DeepSeek AI is an 'evolution', not 'revolution' for tech
articles.author: Seana Smith
articles.summary: The emergence of Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek has stirred global tech markets. New York University Stern School of Business professor of economics Nouriel Roubini, also known as "Dr. Doom," joins Catalysts to discuss its implications for US equities. He recommends to be overweight in tech and the "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

articles.title: Why DeepSeek AI is an 'evolution', not 'revolution' for tech
articles.author: Seana Smith
articles.summary: The emergence of Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek has stirred global tech markets. New York University Stern School of Business professor of economics Nouriel Roubini, also known as "Dr. Doom," joins Catalysts to discuss its implications for US equities. He recommends to be overweight in equities, particularly in tech and the "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

articles.title: Acclaimed designer Jeff Minter is back with a remake of the '80s arcade curio I, Robot
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk
articles.summary: Jeff Minter has remade the 1984 arcade cabinet I, I, Robot. The game was made by Dave Theurer, the guy behind Missile Command and Tempest. Minter's version will be released this spring on pretty much every platform, including Nintendo Switch, PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One and Xbox Series X/S.

articles.title: Trepp Unveils AI-Powered Search, Expanding its Capabilities to Enhance Commercial Real Estate Business
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Trepp announced today the launch of new artificial intelligence (AI) tools, including AI search. Trepp is a leading provider of data, insights, and technology solutions to the structured finance, commercial real estate (CRE), and banking markets. AI Search uses a proprietary generative AI (GenAI)-based model to allow users to ask complex, natural-language questions and instantly retrieve relevant commercial property, loan, and financial data.

articles.title: AI Has Become Part of the Homebuying Journey for One-In-Three Buyers, Veterans United Survey Finds
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: 32% of prospective homebuyers are using AI tools as part of their homebuying journey, according to a survey released today by Veterans United Home Loans. The most common uses of AI are searching for and virtually touring homes, the survey found, and the survey of nearly 900 prospective buyers.

articles.title: AWS Recognizes Agilisium as one of 13 Global Partners with both Generative AI and Life Sciences Consulting Competencies
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: AWS has recognized Agilisium as one of 13 Global Partners with both Generative AI and Life Sciences Consulting competencies. The recognition underscores the strong technical capability and deep domain expertise in transforming business processes and delivering long-term customer value. The company prides itself in having more than 450 AWS certified professionals working for over 20 Fortune 500 Life Sciences clients.

articles.title: AWS Recognizes Agilisium as one of 13 Global Partners with both Generative AI and Life Sciences Consulting Competencies
articles.author: Agilisium Consulting
articles.summary: Agilisium is a partner of Amazon Web Services' AWS Generative AI (AWS) platform and Agilisia Consulting's AI platform, AgiliaWASG. It is a cloud-based AI platform with AI capabilities.

articles.title: You Can Ask AI Chatbots to Summarize News Stories—But They Will Be Wrong
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: According to a study conducted by the BBC, AI chatbots that summarize the news are often inaccurate and are loaded with factual errors. Chatbots have no way of distinguishing between factual reported news stories and opinions. Microsoft's Copilot and Google's Gemini are better for summarizing news than ChatGPT and Perplexity AI.

articles.title: UAE to launch DeepSeek-inspired AI models: senior official
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: The United Arab Emirates is planning to launch new artificial intelligence models inspired by China's DeepSeek system in the near future. The system is disruptive, but it proves that the game is at its beginning, as a senior official said.

articles.title: Tackling Complexities with Simplicity: PPI's Ray Sheen on Threats, Opportunities, & the Uniqueness of Project Management
articles.author: Chris Gallagher
articles.summary: Ray Sheen is President of Product & Process Innovation, Inc., (PPI). He has over 30 years of experience in Project Management. He believes that the ultimate goal of project management should be to provide excellent outcomes in a cost- and time-efficient manner. Ray is not afraid to embrace AI as a tool for efficiency, harnessing its potential.

articles.title: Apple is reportedly exploring humanoid robots
articles.author: Brian Heater
articles.summary: Apple is exploring both humanoid and non-humanoid robotic form factors, according to longtime Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo. Kuo predicts 2028 as an optimistic timeline for mass production of an Apple robot. Apple's research paper explores human interactions with 'non-anthropomorphic' robots, specifically a Pixar-style lamp.

articles.title: Certis Oncology Announces Issuance of U.S. Patent for Its Proprietary CertisAI Predictive Oncology Intelligence™ Platform
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Certis Oncology Solutions, a precision oncology and translational science company, announced today that the USPTO has allowed a patent application directed to Certis's predictive artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) platform, CertisAI™.

articles.title: Gen Z boss hits back over 'concerning' Aussie work trend: 'Sense of entitlement'
articles.author: Stewart Perrie
articles.summary: 37% of employers would rather hire artificial intelligence models over Gen Z graduates. 98% of leaders said their organisation was struggling to find talent and 89% admitted they would avoid recruiting people fresh out of tertiary study. Gen Z entrepreneur Rachael Wilde owns cosmetics company tbh skincare. She has 22 employees at the company, 14 of them fall into the Gen Z category.

articles.title: Certis Oncology Announces Issuance of U.S. Patent for Its Proprietary CertisAI Predictive Oncology Intelligence™ Platform
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Certis Oncology Solutions has received a patent application for its AI/ML platform, CertisAI. It is the first and only commercially available, validated platform that predicts therapeutic efficacy by identifying complex gene expression signatures that correlate with drug response. The patent protection is expected to last until March 2043.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI Is Reportedly Set to Hire Thousands of 'AI Tutors' That Pay Up to $65 an Hour
articles.author: Erin Davis
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI is hiring AI tutors to train its chatbot, Grok, in 2025. There are currently five "AI tutor" roles on xAI's website. The positions are temporary, full-time, remote, and pay $35 to $65 an hour.

articles.title: Generative AI topic of Mid-Michigan AIChE virtual seminar Thursday
articles.author: Midland Daily News
articles.summary: The Mid-Michigan Section of the American Institute of Chemical Engineers will hold its virtual February seminar, Generative Artificial Intelligence for Process Engineering, from noon to 1 p.m. on Thursday, Feb. 13. Prof. Artur M. Schweidtmann, assistant professor at Delft University of Technology, will present the seminar.

articles.title: Thomson Reuters scores early win in AI copyright battles in the US
articles.author: SARAH PARVINI
articles.summary: Thomson Reuters has won an early battle in court over the question of fair use in artificial intelligence-related copyright cases. The media and technology company filed a lawsuit against Ross Intelligence in 2020. Ross Intelligence used materials from Thomson Reuters' own legal platform Westlaw to train an AI model without permission.

articles.title: AI In Space: Astronauts Are Likely To Need Help
articles.author: John Werner
articles.summary: Scientists are working on AI systems to help astronauts in various ways, as they explore what's beyond the confines of the earth's atmosphere. MIT Media Lab is working on a brain computer interface (BCI) that astronauts can use to communicate more easily while they're in space.

articles.title: Why Vertiv (VRT) Is Falling Today
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Vertiv Holdings (VRT) is sinking 6.5% after the company provided lower-than-expected earnings per share guidance for the current quarter. However, the firm's fourth-quarter financial results came in meaningfully above analysts' average estimates. The company markets power and cooling systems for data centers.

articles.title: Richtech Robotics Launches the Richtech Accelerator Program to Bolster AI and Robotics Research at U.S. Universities
articles.author: Richtech Robotics Inc.
articles.summary: Richtech Robotics launched the Richtech Accelerator Program. It aims to bolster AI and robotics research at U.S. universities. Columbia University is the first institution to join the program. Their research will focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP) within Richtech Robotics' robotic systems.

articles.title: Want to Use ChatGPT Like a Pro? These Courses Can Help
articles.author: Techrepublic Academy
articles.summary: The 2025 ChatGPT Skills and Creativity training bundle costs $29.99 for lifetime access. It covers both the technical and creative side of ChatGpt. It teaches you how to communicate with the AI chatbot and how to use AI to improve your productivity.

articles.title: Watch out, Nvidia. OpenAI's proprietary AI chip is coming along
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: According to Reuters, OpenAI could finalize the design of its first 3nm AI chip in the coming months and start mass production at TSMC in 2026. The chip is being developed by a team of AI researchers at OpenAI and is being produced by TSMC.

articles.title: UK Likely to Align with US on Anti-AI Regulation Approach, Official Says
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: The United Kingdom may not sign an international agreement on artificial intelligence (AI) due to concerns raised by the United States over the proposal's heavy focus on AI and AI research. The proposal has been criticised by the U.S. for being too focused on AI research and development.

articles.title: Macron calls for international partnership on AI
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Emmanuel Macron wants international partnership between France, the U.S. and China to work on artificial intelligence, as he informed Menafn on Monday. He also called for international partnership with the United States and China on the matter. MenafN is a news agency.

articles.title: Nobody wants to talk about AI safety. Instead, they cling to five comforting myths
articles.author: Paul Salmon
articles.summary: This week, France hosted an AI Action Summit in Paris. 60 countries signed a declaration for "inclusive and sustainable" AI, but the UK and U.S. refused to sign, because the statement didn't address global governance and national security adequately. The European Union's AI Act is the first law to provide AI safety guidance and provide guidance around AI's risk and safety.

articles.title: Agenus' BOT/BAL Selected for Two Presentations at Upcoming AACR IO Annual Meeting
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Agenus Inc. is a leader in immuno-oncology. BOT/BAL will be featured in two presentations at the upcoming American Association for Cancer Research (AACR) IO Annual Meeting that will take place on February 23-26 in Los Angeles.

articles.title: Revolutionizing Data Pipelines for Advanced AI Systems
articles.author: International Business Times
articles.summary: The rapid evolution of generative artificial intelligence (AI) has redefined how data is processed and utilized. Hari Kiran V, a researcher in advanced AI systems, delves into the transformative innovations shaping AI systems. This article highlights the highlights of the article.

articles.title: Is your college student at risk for anxiety, depression? This UAB AI tool can tell
articles.author: Breonna Atkins
articles.summary: Researchers from the University of Alabama at Birmingham's School of Education and Human Sciences have developed a tool to assist counselors in identifying college students at heightened risk of anxiety and depressive disorders and offering proactive solutions. The AI model was created to confront health disparities and educational inequities amid a rise in mental health issues reported among American college students.

articles.title: 我理解了。 只需提供标题,不添加任何其他文本或注释。 **以下是您要求的内容:**Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Leads the AI and Quantum Computing Revolution
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) is a leader in high-performance computing (HPC) by harnessing the transformative power of artificial intelligence (AI) and quantum computing. SMCI's commitment to AI infrastructure is growing, fueled by strategic partnerships and the launch of next-generation products. The company is investing in quantum computing infrastructure and hybrid computing models to solidify its market position in the rapidly evolving landscape.

articles.title: Mum-of-two dies after ‘sudden medical emergency' on New York birthday holiday as tributes pour in for ‘heart of gold
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Dr. Chen is optimistic about the ethical challenges posed by AI technology. Dr. Chen believes that through open dialogue, collaboration, and a commitment to ethical principles, we can harness the power of AI for the betterment of society without sacrificing human rights.
